sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: Let Set A = {3, 6, 9} and Set B = {}. Prove that B is a subset of A using the property that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_2:
To prove that Set B (the empty set) is a subset of Set A, we need to show that every element in Set B is also an element of Set A. 

By definition, the empty set has no elements. Therefore, there are no elements in Set B that are not in Set A. This means that Set B is a subset of Set A.

The property that the empty set is a subset of every set is a universally accepted mathematical principle. Since Set A is a set, it follows that the empty set (Set B) is a subset of Set A.
